intro: Reseda undata var. leucantha, commonly known as white sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. The species is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered an invasive weed in certain regions.
